verses.text: 只傳耶穌基督釘十字架弟兄們，我從前到你們那裡去，並沒有用高言大智向你們傳講　神的奧祕。

words.note: Lit. 'nailed to the cross'
Refers to fellow believers
Used before 不/沒 for emphasis
Refers to eloquent and sophisticated discourse
Elevated character indicating reverence for God

verses.text: 因為我曾立定主意，在你們中間甚麼都不想知道，只知道耶穌基督和他釘十字架的事。

words.note: Indicates a past action or experience
To firmly decide
Refers to one's resolve or plan
Used in negative sentences to mean 'nothing at all'
Lit. 'nailed to the cross'

verses.text: 我在你們那裡的時候，又軟弱又懼怕，而且戰戰兢兢；

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with the preceding clause
Often used spiritually in biblical contexts
Describes extreme apprehension and caution (idiom)

verses.text: 我說的話、講的道，都不是用智慧的話去說服人，而是用聖靈和能力來證明，

words.note: Nominalizes the preceding verb phrase
Often implies formal or public speaking
Nominalizes the preceding verb phrase
Refers to the Christian message or truth
Indicates the purpose or direction of an action
Lit. 'holy spirit'
Indicates purpose or means, 'to come and do'

verses.text: 使你們的信不是憑著人的智慧，而是憑著　神的能力。

words.note: Short for 信心 (xìnxīn)
Indicates dependence or the method used
Indicates dependence or the method used
Elevated character indicating reverence for God

verses.text: 屬靈的人看透萬事然而在信心成熟的人中間，我們也講智慧，但不是這世代的智慧，也不是這世代將要滅亡的執政者的智慧。

words.note: Lit. 'belonging to the spirit'
Implies thorough understanding
Lit. 'ten thousand matters'
Often refers to religious faith
Can refer to a historical period or a group of people
Indicates future tense
Lit. 'those who hold power'

verses.text: 我們所講的，是從前隱藏的、　神奧祕的智慧，就是　神在萬世以前，為我們的榮耀所預定的；

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon
The preceding space indicates reverence
Lit. 'ten thousand ages'

verses.text: 這智慧，這世代執政的人沒有一個知道，如果他們知道，就不會把榮耀的主釘在十字架上了。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb that is being acted upon
Lit. 'cross-shaped frame'
Indicates completed action or change of state

verses.text: 正如經上所記：「　神為愛他的人所預備的，是眼睛未曾見過，耳朵未曾聽過，人心也未曾想到的。」

words.note: Refers to written holy texts
Indicates something that has never happened

verses.text: 但　神卻藉著聖靈把這些向我們顯明了，因為聖靈測透萬事，連　神深奧的事也測透了。

words.note: Indicates a contrast or unexpected turn
Lit. 'holy spirit'
Implies understanding deeply

verses.text: 除了在人裡面的靈，誰能知道人的事呢？同樣，除了　神的靈，也沒有人知道　神的事。

words.note: Often refers to the human spirit or divine spirit in a religious context.
Refers to the Creator God in Abrahamic religions.
Here refers to God's Spirit.

verses.text: 我們所領受的，不是這世界的靈，而是從　神來的靈，使我們能知道　神開恩賜給我們的事。

words.note: Often indicates passive voice or nominalization of a verb phrase.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, 'that which is received'.
Often used with 是 in '不是...而是...' (not...but...)
Lit. 'open grace'.

verses.text: 我們也講這些事，不是用人的智慧所教的言語，而是用聖靈所教的言語，向屬靈的人解釋屬靈的事（「向屬靈的人解釋屬靈的事」或譯：「用屬靈的話解釋屬靈的事」）。

words.note: Refers to the third person of the Trinity.
Lit. 'belonging to the spirit'.

verses.text: 然而屬血氣的人不接受　神的靈的事，因為他以為是愚笨的；而且他也不能夠明白，因為這些事，要有屬靈的眼光才能領悟。

words.note: Refers to the unregenerate human nature, often contrasted with 'spiritual'.
Lit. 'eye-light'.

verses.text: 屬靈的人能看透萬事，卻沒有人能看透他，
如經上所記：「誰曾知道主的心意，能夠指教他呢？」但我們已經得著基督的心意了。

words.note: Refers to 'in the Bible' or 'as it is written'.
Forms passive/nominalized clause '所記' (that which is written).
Indicates a past action or experience.
In Christian contexts, refers to God or Jesus Christ.
In biblical context, often refers to God's will or purpose.
More formal than '教' (jiāo), implying guidance and instruction.
Softens the tone of a question or indicates a rhetorical question.
Implies successfully obtaining something.
Transliteration of Greek 'Christos', meaning 'Anointed One'.
Here, referring to the mind or purpose of Christ.
Indicates the completion or actualization of an action.
